texts.definition: The ability of agent to gives responses in a conversation depending on all relevant game states.
markups: <style="Definition">The ability of agent to gives responses in a conversation depending on all relevant game states.</style>

Conversations in games may be constructed so they are generic and function in many different settings. When they instead are specific for the current context in which they are taking place, they provide <style="CurrentLink">Contextualized Conversational Responses</style>.

Although only being weak examples of the pattern, non-player characters in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Fallout%20New%20Vegas">Fallout New Vegas</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Skyrim">Skyrim</link></style> have different dialogues when they have moved between places as part of player's progress in quests. While this is really because the players have gotten further in the quests, referencing to the current locations can provide an illusion that the non-player characters say different things depending on the context.

Although not much of a conversation, the quotes when selecting individual units in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Warcraft%20series">Warcraft III</link></style> are the same for all units of the same type. The default response when talking to any guard in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Skyrim">Skyrim</link></style> is "I was an adventurer like you, then I took an arrow in the knee".

The primary choice when creating <style="CurrentLink">Contextualized Conversational Responses</style> is whether to do it through creating rules in <style="Link"><link="algorithmic-agents">Algorithmic Agents</link></style> or providing specific <style="Link"><link="dialogues">Dialogues</link></style>. In the latter case, the pattern can emerge through the use of either <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Character-Specific%20Dialogues">Character-Specific Dialogues</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Location-Specific%20Dialogues">Location-Specific Dialogues</link></style>.

Using <style="CurrentLink">Contextualized Conversational Responses</style> provides <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Context%20Dependent%20Dialogues">Context Dependent Dialogues</link></style> and in turn <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Thematically%20Consistent%20Dialogues">Thematically Consistent Dialogues</link></style>. By providing <style="Link"><link="algorithmic-agents">Algorithmic Agents</link></style> with the possibility of expressing the proper emotions regarding a specific context, the pattern can also help show that they have their <style="Link"><link="own-agenda">Own Agenda</link></style>.
